intro: Cynanchum hastifolium subsp. hastifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dogbane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant features slender, branching stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically greenish-white with a distinctive, milky sap. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
